title.narrative: 304 SOCIAL AND BEHAVIOUR CHANGE CAPACITY FOR Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022 government, partners, and civil society at national and state level have adequate institutional capacity to support social and behaviour change to enable the most deprived to access and use Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in selected states., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Infants, young children, and caregivers especially the most vulnerable have equitable access to and use sustainable, safe, and affordable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services (including in Institutions) across the lifecycle.

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination
Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022 government, partners, and civil society at national and state level have adequate institutional capacity to support social and behaviour change to enable the most deprived to access and use WASH services in selected states.

description.narrative: UNICEF as lead technical partner for WASH has developed and strengthened the behaviour change communication components across various flagship programmes across several sectors (WASH, Education and Health), notably the SBM, contributing to strengthen peoples' movement with campaigns, institutionalization of communication capacity building and effective community engagement. As a result, several surveys report that more than 90% of toilet built under the SBM are effectively being used by household members. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF supported districts using 80% or more of WASH flagship IEC funds available (as per national guidelines) against a specific districts SBCC plan
Number of UNICEF supported districts with government recognised SBCC pool of trainers who are engaged to use their skills
Number of Districts that have integrated SBCC evidence based WASH plans reaching 80% achievement rate
